newsitem.title: MAURITIUS: Mauritius rupee weakens vs dollar and stg.
newsitem.headline: Mauritius rupee weakens vs dollar and stg.

text.p: The Mauritian rupee was fixed weaker against both the dollar and the pound on Tuesday, reflecting international market trends, currency dealers said.
The rupee was quoted at a mean commercial rate of 21.7665 to the dollar from 21.7105 on Monday and at 35.5135 to the pound from 35.424.

Dealers said the dollar had surged on international markets on speculation that the Federal Reserve would raise interest rates. They added that in the local market there was a dollar rush as importers forecast further strengthening of the U.S. currency.
"The fact that demand for dollars exceeds supply in the local market, coupled with international factors, made the rupee weaker," one dealer said.
Forex dealers said the central bank was seen selling dollars in the interbank forex market on Monday afternoon at a price above the prevailing interbank rate.
